1.content:
Kevin Staples has always been a guy with a big heart.

When he was fifteen years old, he jumped in a lake and rescued his dog Rover, after the dog slipped into the lake, which was right behind the house where he lived.

When Kevin was sixteen, he spotted an oncoming truck when a little toddler had strolled onto the street in front of his house. The toddler never saw the truck coming, but Kevin ran and grabbed the little boy just before the truck slowed down.

After his seventeenth birthday, Kevin rescued a boy during a weekend-long camp which was organized by the Boy Scouts. The boy got lost during a long hike up a mountain, and Kevin searched for the lost scout until he found the boy, while he was hiding in a cavern. The younger scout was tired and hungry, but Kevin had given him food and water, and he led the lost scout back to camp.

Right after Kevin's eighteenth birthday, he came to the aide of a boy in school, who was being bullied by a senior in high school. Kevin had stopped the fight and he had persuaded the bully to leave the boy alone. The bully decided to leave, and the boy thanked Kevin repeatedly.

When Kevin was about to leave the schoolyard, the boy called out his name.

"Kevin! Kevin!" the boy shouted to him.

Kevin stopped and turned around, thinking that the boy probably had wanted to thank him one last time.

"There is something I need to tell you..."

"What is it?" Kevin wondered. "I need to get home and work on a paper, which is due tomorrow. I don't have much time..."

“My name is Nuncio…” the boy replied. “I have seen your good deeds, and I have come to grant you your reward for your compassion and generosity!”

“What?”

“I’m a messenger from heaven…” Nuncio continued. “I have watched you since you were young, and I have seen how you have helped and saved lives of others. Plus, your father and mother have done a tremendous amount of volunteer work, so the sense of compassion has been instilled in you as well…”

Kevin’s father was a doctor and his mother worked for the hospital. In fact, his mother would ride in an ambulance and help those who needed medical assistance. After his parents got divorced, he continued to live with his mother and he often spent weekends at his father’s house, whenever his father didn’t have to be in the hospital.

“How do you know all that? What do you want from me?” Kevin stuttered, as he listened to the strange boy.

“From now on, you will have the power to assist other young men who are the same age as you, or younger! You may only use your power as long as it is beneficial to those, who you use it on. You cannot use your power to harm or hurt anyone. Your powers will not work if you use them for evil or selfish purpose. Other than that, you will have the ability to change and grow any young male, who is your age or younger. Your powers will not work on girls or young women!”

“You must be joking, right?”

“No, Kevin… I’m very serious.” Nuncio replied. “Use your new powers wisely. Help the boys and young men. Make them into athletes, workers, and men, who will contribute something useful to society. Don’t worry about the women, for they will have their own angels, who have the ability to change them, just like you have the ability to change men or boys. Focus on helping young men, and you’ll do fine!”

“But… What if I screw up? What if I make a mistake?”

“I will follow you and watch what you do. If you need me, I’ll be there!”

Then, the boy slowly faded away. Within moments, Nuncio had disappeared.

Kevin was left standing alone in front of his school. What was he going to do now?

Keven then heard the sound of a ball bouncing coming from behind him. He turned around, and saw that a boy was walking down the sidewalk towards him, dribbling a basketball. The boy was rather short, coming in at only 4'4", and was very skinny, with bright red, spiky hair. Kevin looked at him for a moment, and came to realize that the boy's name was Gabe, that he was eleven years old, and that he had dreams of playing basketball in the NBA, but that no matter how good he was or how hard he practiced, his coaches would always say he was too short, and would never start him. He wished to be taller, but the doctors would say that he wouldn't grow any taller than 5' 2", even as an adult. Kevin decided to rectify that problem.

When Gabe got close to Kevin, Kevin simply called out, "Gabe!" Gabe turned and looked at Kevin. Though he was a friendly kid, he was also weary of talking to strangers, so he nervously said, "Hi."

"I see that you like basketball, Gabe," Kevin said. "That you dream of playing in the NBA someday."

"Uh, yeah," Gabe said. "But I can't. I'm too short."

"What if I told you that I could help you get in the NBA right now?" Kevin asked.

"Huh?" Gabe said, dumbfounded. "What are you talking about?"

"I can't really explain," Kevin said, "but if you want to, I can help you. Do you trust me?"

"Well..." Gabe said, trying to decide if it was worth believing this stranger in order to pursue his dream further. '"...Okay. What do I have to do?"

"Nothing," Kevin said. "Just stand right there." Kevin closed his eyes, and pictured Gabe growing and becoming taller than anyone he knew.

Gabe looked at Kevin with a quizzical look, trying to figure out what this strange older boy was doing with his eyes closed, lost deep in what looked like a trance. After a few seconds, though, Gabe felt his legs begin to burn, and he looked down at them, only to notice that they were becoming longer, and that his face was becoming farther and farther from the ground!

As his legs grew longer, his torso also stretched out, and quickly Gabe felt every muscle and bone in his body vibrate and stretch with a tremendous growth surge. He quickly grew past five feet, and then five and a half. He was now taller than Kevin was, and wasn't slowing down! Six feet, six and a half, seven! He kept growing and growing. His clothes were getting bigger with him, luckily, and now seemed to be an extra extra large, at least.

And as quickly as it started, the tingling stopped, and his growth slowed down, finally halting at an amazing seven feet eleven inches. "Wow!" was all Gabe could say, as he looked over his now lanky arms and legs, and looked down at Kevin's face, which was now beaming up at him, proud.

"Well, I'm not done yet," Kevin said, and he closed his eyes again. This time, he focused on Gabe's muscles, and Gabe felt his arms and legs pulsating with power, his biceps and triceps, his pecs and abs thickening, ripping and tearing and mending again all in one instant. It was like he was getting years worth of working out all in just a few seconds. He kept packing on the muscle until, finally, Kevin opened his eyes again, and the muscle growth stopped, with Gabe now the strength of a giant. He still had a lean figure, with no excess weight on him, but his arm, chest, and leg muscles now bulged outward with an immense power.

"Almost done," Kevin said. "Now I have to change the world to fit you." He concentrated again, and Gabe felt his mind now changing, and the world growing hazy around him. He closed his eyes, and memories rushed into his consciousness: of going to the doctor at two years old, already four feet tall and growing; of first picking up a basketball and taking to it instantly; of going to elementary school, towering over his classmates; of being approached by an NBA scout seeing him play at a pickup game in the park, and being offered a tryout; of knocking the socks off of the scouts and being signed to a nice contract, and working his way into the starting rotation, the tallest and strongest player in the league.

Gabe opened his eyes back up and looked down. The setting around him had changed, he was now in the locker room of the Orlando Magic, dressed in a jersey that had his name on the back, and ready to play. The rest of his team had already started heading towards the court, and he heard the crowd chanting, "We want Gabe! We want Gabe!"

Gabe looked at Kevin, who was now sitting down on the bench, smiling, with tears in his eyes. This was everything he had dreamed of, all coming true at once! "Thank you," he whispered softly.

"Don't mention it," Kevin replied. "Now get out there and make me proud!"

He slapped Gabe on the backside, and Gabe ran out to the team, to the cheers of adoring fans. Kevin quietly slipped out the back of the locker room, pleased with himself, and contemplating what to do next.

The rest of Kevin's walk home turned out to be uneventful, not passing any other boys who he could test his powers on. As he walked up the front steps to his house, however, he heard the sound of boys laughing and yelling coming from the backyard of the house next door.

He crossed through his house, noting that he was the only one home right now, and headed to the backyard. The neighbor's yard was separated from his by a wooden fence, but one that only stood five feet high so Kevin could still look over it and see what was happening on the other side. Three boys were playing in the backyard, running around and chasing each other. Kevin recognized one of the boys as Ethan, the 11-year old who lived there. Ethan was a skinny kid but rather tall for his age, just a couple inches under five feet, fair-skinned with medium-length, unkempt blonde hair and green eyes. He was an only child and didn't usually have many friends over, mostly staying inside playing video games or reading, so Kevin was glad to see him outside getting exercise and having fun with boys his own age.

He walked over to the fence and leaned his arms against it, casually watching the boys play. They seemed to be running at each other, dodging free and avoiding hitting each other at the last minute.

After a few minutes, one of Ethan's friends, a shorter black boy, slightly more toned than Ethan, with his hair in medium-length twists, looked up and saw Kevin. "Hey, Ethan," he said, "who's that?"

Ethan looked over, saw Kevin, and smiled. "Oh, hi Kevin!" he said, waving. "Jaden, he's just our neighbor; he lives there." He pointed to Kevin's house.

Jaden nodded and turned his attention back to the task at hand: getting in position and ready to run towards the third boy, standing at the other side of the yard, a slightly stocky boy almost as tall as Ethan, with tanned skinned and short brown hair.

"What are you guys doing?" Kevin asked, smirking a little.

"Oh, we're just playing Flinch-Out," Ethan answered. "We each take turns running at each other at full speed. Whoever flinches or slows down first is the loser. Troy's winning, so far," he said, indicating the boy who was at the other end of the yard.

Kevin chuckled and shook his head. It sounded kinda stupid, but he remembered doing a lot of stupid stuff when he was younger.

Both he and Ethan watched as the other two boys started running at each other. Each seemed to be getting faster, gaining speed as they got closer to each other, until...

SMACK

"Owwwww," Jaden said, having fallen to the ground. He rubbed his head, wincing. "You head-butted me!"

"No, you just ran into my head!" Troy said, hopping to his feet. He offered a hand to Jaden and helped him up. The two then brushed their clothes clean of the dirt and grass on them.

"Maybe we shouldn't play this any more, guys," Ethan said. "I don't think my mom wants to take any of us to the hospital."

"Well," Troy said, "then what should we do?"

Ethan looked at Kevin. "What do you think, Kevin? Have any ideas?"

A little surprised to be asked for his opinion, Kevin had to think for a moment before finally suggesting, "How 'bout wrestling? That's a little safer... probably."

The three boys seemed to like that suggestion, and they started talking about who should go first. Kevin, though, smiled as he thought about how he could have some fun with this. Finally, the boys were ready.

"Ladies and gentlemen," Troy said, in a manner like a ringside announcer, talking to no one in particular, "our first matchup tonight--"

"Tonight?" Jaden interrupted. "It's 3:30 in the afternoon!"

"Shuddup!" Troy said, then continued. "Our first matchup tonight features two of the greatest wrestlers ever to enter the ring! In this corner," he motioned to Jaden, "standing four feet five inches tall and weighing in at seventy-six pounds--"

Jaden punched Troy in the arm. "Hey! It's seventy-nine now!"

"--Seventy-nine pounds, please welcome Jaden 'The Chocolate Volcano' Clark!"

Jaden strutted around in a circle, waving to an imaginary crowd as Troy mimicked the sound of people cheering, with a few boos mixed in for good measure.

Once Jaden finished, Troy continued, "And in this corner," he motioned to Ethan, "standing four feet ten inches tall and weighing in at eighty-four pounds, please welcome Ethan 'Beanpole' Christensen!"

Ethan shook his head, smiling, then gave a half-hearted wave while Troy made the crowd sounds again. Finally, Ethan and Jaden got into position. "Alright, gentlemen," Troy said, "I want a good clean match. No fighting dirty. Are you ready?" Both boys nodded. "Then... FIGHT!"

The two boys began circling around, poised and ready. Jaden made the first move, trying to grasp Ethan around the waist. Ethan eluded his grasp, twisting around, causing Jaden to lose his balance. He then jumped onto Jaden's back, trying to bring him to the ground.

As Kevin watched from the other side of the fence, he couldn't help but think that he should try to make the match more interesting, and now was as good a time as any. He waited until Jaden was pinned down, trying to break free from Ethan's grasp, then slowly concentrated on increasing Jaden's muscles. Jaden's already well-built (for his age) chest began to push outward, causing his shirt to get tighter. His abs became more developed, and his arms swelled outward, the fabric of his sleeves pressing into his biceps. Kevin also made sure that Jaden's leg muscles kept up with the rest of the boy's body, causing his thighs to swell and his calves to harden and stick out like softballs. In order to get all these muscles to grow, Kevin also had to make the boy's frame bigger, adding several inches to his height.

All these changes occurred over the course of a few seconds, and Jaden was quickly able to turn the tables and start pinning down Ethan. Fair's fair, Kevin thought, and he began to shift his attention over to Ethan. There was less for him to work with here as Ethan was very slender, so Kevin first added a muscle base all over Ethan's body, then narrowed his focus to the upper body, causing his chest to swell out and push against his arms, which were also adding on pound after pound of muscle. His abs became incredibly well-defined to the point where they started forming a "V-shape." Kevin also made sure Ethan's legs weren't left out, giving them the same treatment as Jaden's. Since Ethan already was taller with a larger frame, Kevin decided to just broaden his shoulders a little and then switch back to focus on his muscles, making them so big that he heard a loud RIPPPPPP as Ethan's shirt and shorts began to tear.

With all these extra muscles, Ethan was easily able to overcome Jaden and pin him down. Troy counted out, and then grasped Ethan's wrist. "The winner: Eth--What the hell?!" It was only now that the boys began to notice the changes Kevin had made. Jaden and Ethan both jumped to their feet and examined their own bodies, running their hands up and down the smooth curves of their arm muscles. Jaden's clothes, tight as they were, still were able to stay together, though his too-short shirt now revealed his six-pack abs. Ethan's clothes, however, were in tatters, and everyone could see the incredible chest and leg muscles underneath them, not to mention his amazing eight-pack abs.

"We - we've gotten huge!" Ethan cried out. He then noticed Jaden looking at him straight in the eye, without having to tilt his head up. "And you've gotten taller!"

"Holy crap!" Jaden exclaimed. "This is awesome!!"

"How the hell did you guys do that?" Troy asked, slightly jealous that he didn't get any of the changes.

"I have no idea," Ethan said. "Hey, watch this!" He brought his arms into a pose, causing his muscles to flex. Troy's eyes widened as he could see thick, pulsing veins running through the muscles. The remains of his shirt completely tore off, and what looked like rags fluttered to the ground, leaving Ethan's smooth, sculpted torso completely bare.

Kevin enjoyed watching this display of his work, deciding not to say anything to the boys, at least not just yet. As they continue to marvel at themselves, Kevin decided what to do next.

Instead of being at a small field, they were now at a large stadium, with maybe ten thousand people in the crowd, not exactly a major league game, but incredible turnout for a bunch of high schoolers. Kevin decided the pool would be the most fun to change someone at. Not wanting to feel out of place, he changed into a pair of board shorts he had in his backpack. Around the pool, there were people of all ages swimming, sunbathing, and enjoying being outside in the nice weather.

As he walked over towards the deep end, Kevin noticed a boy sitting by himself, dangling his feet into the pool and looking sad. The boy looked about 14, had olive skin and short dark hair, and was a bit chubby. Kevin wandered closer towards the boy, and focused his energy on him, reading his mind.

The boy's thoughts quickly flooded over him. His name was Vic, and both his parents had died in a car crash when he was nine. He was sent here to live with his very strict aunt, who home-schooled him and rarely let him leave the house. As a result, he had no friends, had a very poor body image, and was very socially awkward, even for a teenager. To top it off, he had recently realized he was gay, which he knew would cause his aunt to go ballistic, so he had to struggle to keep that inside too. Every week he would come out to the pool, always sitting at the side, watching everyone else have fun, and wishing he could be one of them.

Feeling really sorry for Vic, Kevin decided to go talk to him. As he sat down, Vic turned away, extremely uncomfortable.

"Relax, Vic," Kevin said.

"W-who are you? H-how do you know my name?" Vic asked.

"My name's Kevin, and I know a lot about you," he replied. "I'm here to help."

Vic stared straight down at the water, saying nothing for a long time.

Finally, under his breath, he said, "To help, you'd have to change everything about me."

"Okay," Kevin said, smiling. He concentrated, imagining the body fat on Vic melting away. Vic felt a little tingling, and looked down to see his body becoming skinnier, and more fit.

"Holy cow!" Vic said, "What's happening?"

"Do you like it?" Kevin asked.

"Yeah! Did you do this?" Vic said.

Kevin nodded. He made a few minor touches, adding a little muscle to give Vic a nice swimmer's build, and growing out his hair to be shaggy, covering his ears, complementing his new body very well.

Vic looked at his reflection in the water. "I look like a completely different person!" he exclaimed. "What else can you do?"

"I'd like to be older, if that's possible," Vic finally said. "I want to be able to be my own person, and live my own life."

Kevin smiled. "That's true of pretty much everybody at your age," he said, "but knowing what you're going through, I can hardly blame you."

Vic gave a half smile, then looked away, nervous. "I guess that may be too much to ask, though."

"Well," mused Kevin. "I can make you as old as 18. At that point, my powers don't apply anymore, so I wouldn't be able to change anything else about you. Are you sure that's what you want?"

Vic looked at Kevin intensely, and Kevin noticed how deep and pleading his brown eyes were.

"Okay, then," Kevin said, "but since I can't change you any more, I'm also going to make it so that you don't remember any of this."

"What?" Vic asked. "Why?"

"Look, I want you to be happy," Kevin said as he put his hand on Vic's shoulder. "If you know that you're whole life was changed all because of some other person, you'll probably always have that kernel of doubt or regret in the back of your head. But I can make you think that you were supposed to be that way, that this is the only way for you to be. You may not be grateful, but you'll be content. And that's what you want, right?"

Vic's eyes were starting to tear up. "Wow, man. I've never met anyone like you before."

"Don't worry," Kevin said. "I'm not the only good guy out there. As long as you stay true to yourself in here," Kevin said as he pointed to his heart, "then you'll find someone else that you might spend the rest of your life with."

Kevin stood up, helping Vic up too. Vic embraced Kevin, wiping the tears away. "I'll never forget you, man."

"Yes, you will," Kevin said, chuckling.

He patted Vic on the back, and then walked away. Without looking back, he knew Vic was looking after him, wanting to go with him, but resisting. Kevin concentrated, making sure the first thing he did was wipe Vic's memory of him, so that he could turn around and watch from a distance as he made the changes.

When he did, he noticed that Vic was now lying down on a beach chair, socializing with a couple of girls and a guy around his own age, laughing and having a good time. Kevin smiled, then focused again on Vic, and started to make his changes.

First, Vic started to grow taller, until he was around 6 foot 3. His facial features started to get more defined, losing the last bit of baby fat. He still looked like a skinny 14 year old, so Kevin started adding muscle, starting at the top and working down. He expanded Vic's shoulders outward, and shaped his chest until his pecs were firm, forming a V-shaped torso. He then added a six-pack to his abs, and increased his arm muscles until they were twice as thick as before. His thighs and legs slowly expanded outwards, and Kevin made sure that they had just a tiny bit of hair. Finally, to top it all off, he gave Vic a thin layer of stubble on his chin.

Kevin relaxed his concentration, and took a look at his work. Vic was now with three other guys around his new age, one of which he seemed to be really close with, flirting and holding hands. He also had lost the board shorts in favor of a sexy black speedo. Kevin looked closer and noticed that the guy who he assumed was Vic's boyfriend actually held a strong resemblance to Kevin himself. He smiled. "I guess even my powers can't clean his memory of everything."

Satisfied with his work, Kevin turned and walked away from the pool. He knew in his heart that he had done good, but also, that there was much, much more work to do.

1331321.content:
All of the sudden, Kevin was surrounded by a bright light, that swirled around him, starting from his feet and working his way to his head. His skin began to feel very warm, and he shielded his eyes. After a few short seconds and a loud sound that resembled a sonic boom, the light suddenly disappeared, and Kevin opened his eyes to find himself in the middle of a wooded area, surrounded by trees. He looked around, not seeing any sign of civilization or humans in general.

"Nuncio! Are you there?" he asked aloud.

"Yes, Kevin, I'm here with you." Nuncio responded.

"Where am I?" Kevin said. "When am I?"

"You are in the year 1754. August 2nd, 4:23 pm, to be precise. You are near a small tribe of Algonquin Indians. And in a little under an hour, these Indians are going to be slaughtered by a group of British soldiers are going to come upon this camp and massacre them -- men, women, and children, mercilessly and without warning."

"That's terrible!" Kevin responded. "What do you want me to do?"

All of then sudden, Kevin heard a rustling sound in the trees, and saw a group of three boys get closer. They were about fourteen or fifteen years old, and wearing only loincloths, with some warpaint smeared messily along their faces. They were talking to each other; surprisingly, though they weren't speaking English, Kevin could understand them.

"Of course I am the best hunter out of all of us," the oldest boy, who appeared to be the leader, said. He was about five feet eight, with long dark hair falling down past his shoulders, and he was carrying a bow with arrows. "No one can hit a target better than me!"

"Well, I'm the fastest out of all of us," the shortest boy said. He had relatively short hair, and was the skinniest amongst the group. "I can catch up with anything I'm chasing!"

"But you won't be able to take it down when you do," the third boy said. He was slightly shorter than the leader, but appeared to be more stocky and muscular. "That's my strength; nothing can out-wrestle me!"

Kevin watched these boys from a distanced, and trailed them as they got moved through the woods.

"These three boys are the key to this tribe's safety," Nuncio said. "They are the only teenage boys in their group, and they have the heart and the inner strength to defend their families. But they need your help."

"Got it!" Kevin said. "I'll grow them all big and strong so they can beat back the British!"

"Not so fast," Nuncio said. "The time traveling experienced zapped some of the power I gave out of you. You have to make a choice: you can either grow one of these boys to be a true giant, or you can grow all three of them so that they're big and strong but not true giants."
